statement.tex: %text Find the area of the region % \[ \lbrace (x,y): x^2+y^2\leq 4, x + y\geq 2 \rbrace \]
\\ \textbf{What area?}\\ %text In the figure below, is the shaded region the required area? %
\\ %text If $R$ be the required area, then is the following correct? %
\\ %text What will the value of $R$ be given the expression from Step 2? %

reason.tex:
\lbrace (x,y): \underbrace{x^2+y^2\leq 4}_{\text{inside the circle}}, \underbrace{x+y\geq 2}_{\text{on or above the line}} \rbrace\\ %text
If a point $(x,y)$ satisfies $x^2+y^2=4$, then $(x,y)$ is \underline\text{on the circle}. But if $x^2+y^2\lt 4$, then $(x,y)$ is \underline\text{inside} the circle.
Similarly, if $(x,y)$ satisfies $x+y = 2$, then $(x,y)$ lies on the line. But if $x+y\gt 2$, then $(x,y)$ lies \underline\text{above} the line.
Hence, we are looking for $(x,y)$ that are inside a circle but above a line. %
